items.title: Wallabies fall to 28-26 defeat against Argentina in The Rugby Championship in Sydney
items.summary: The Wallabies have fallen just short of a magical comeback against Argentina, losing 28-26 in a thrilling Rugby Championship Test in Sydney.

items.title: Is the pink soap scum in my bathroom mould, or something else?
items.summary: Have you ever noticed a pink or orange-coloured substance in the tile grout or around taps in your bathroom? In most cases, it's one of two things.

items.title: NRL finals live: Penrith Panthers take down New Zealand Warriors, Cronulla Sharks face Sydney Roosters
items.summary: Former Penrith premiership winner Luke Lewis says a vital try in the Panthers' 24-8 win over the Warriors should not have stood as their hunt for a fifth straight NRL premiership continues. Follow live.

items.title: At least 190 people reported dead after two boat capsizes in DRC Congo
items.summary: Hundreds of people have died and scores are missing from separate boat accidents this week in north-western Congo.

items.title: NSW government to roll out capped taxi fares from Sydney Airport
items.summary: A New York-style approach to taxi fees will roll out at Sydney Airport in a bid to put an end to fare rip-offs.

items.title: Australian-funded PALM scheme liaison workers say they went months without pay
items.summary: Pacific Islanders supporting PALM workers say they have had to go to great lengths — including flying to their home countries — to chase money owed to them.

items.title: Who is Tyler Robinson, the accused killer of Charlie Kirk?
items.summary: After his father encouraged Tyler Robinson to turn himself in, people close to the 22-year-old provided investigators with crucial insights.

items.title: Homebuyers turn to shared ownership in expensive Wollongong market
items.summary: Friends Gem and Renata have saved money buying a home together with their respective families in Wollongong, and say the pay-off goes much further.

items.title: Cost of living, housing among key concerns in SA marginal seat of Boothby
items.summary: At this year’s federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the state’s two marginal seats. As part of the ABC’s “Your Say” campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

items.title: Murdochs resolve succession saga but family's hold on empire is vulnerable
items.summary: Rupert Murdoch's family has always been close. But if you really want to trace the extent of filial and sibling affection, you need to follow the money.

items.title: Australians tell ABC's Your Say they are struggling more than ever with housing costs
items.summary: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

items.title: Erika Kirk makes first public statement after assassination of husband Charlie Kirk
items.summary: Charlie Kirk's widow, Erika, delivers her first public remarks since the fatal shooting of her influencer husband.

items.title: 'Bubble curtain' ready to protect cuttlefish as algal bloom persists in SA
items.summary: A "bubble curtain" is set for activation as part of South Australia's fight against the ongoing algal bloom, as the state government defends its handling of health advice.

items.title: Haven't started on your tax return and feeling overwhelmed?
items.summary: Despite being something most of us tackle every year, lodging a tax return can easily end up at the bottom of your to-do list.

items.title: What's next for the far-right political movement in Australia?
items.summary: Australia's far-right movement has been buoyed by a wave of recent protests against mass immigration, with some saying the rallies were the "biggest thing that's happened in conservative and nationalist politics for a hundred years".

items.title: Australia on alert to shot-hole borer threat as WA pivots to tree canopy rehabilitation
items.summary: It's barely the size of a sesame seed, but the shot-hole borer has quickly devastated Western Australia's tree canopy. Experts are warning other states and territories to take action now to avoid a similar fate.

items.title: Voters tell ABC's Your Say they want politicians with a vision, not bickering
items.summary: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they want courage and vision from politicians, not bickering.

items.title: Elderly Porepunkah woman left without in-home care as Freeman manhunt continues
items.summary: Elderly residents of Porepunkah have had their home nurse visits cancelled as alleged police killer Dezi Freeman remains at large.

items.title: Limestone Coast is a food bowl and forestry powerhouse, but its water supply is under threat
items.summary: South Australia's Limestone Coast is home to lush terrain in Australia's driest state, but its groundwater supplies are slowly in decline.

items.title: Reserve Bank restructure closer to reality after Treasurer Jim Chalmers offers olive branch to Angus Taylor
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of Australia is a step closer to its biggest restructure in three decades after the treasurer offers an assurance to his Coalition counterpart.

items.title: Australians watched the moment of Charlie Kirk's assassination on social media with no warning
items.summary: Young Australians say they are seeing graphic video of US commentator Charlie Kirk being shot dead pop up in their social media algorithms without warning.

items.title: Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital cancels children in war discussion citing staff safety
items.summary: Melbourne's Royal Children's Hospital says a symposium on the effect of war on children has been cancelled due to safety fears, but some doctors say pressure from a group opposing antisemitism is to blame.

items.title: Kiama by-election counting underway as voters replace disgraced MP Gareth Ward
items.summary: Counting is underway as the south coast NSW electorate votes for a new member in state Parliament after the resignation of convicted rapist Gareth Ward.

items.title: Right-wing activist and Trump ally Charlie Kirk shot dead at Utah university
items.summary: Donald Trump confirms Charlie Kirk has been shot dead in front of a crowd of horrified students, with the US president describing the conservative activist as a "tremendous person" and a "very good friend".

items.title: 'Clone' websites catch out Australian customers as online shopping scams become 'alarmingly' common
items.summary: Online shopping scams are now one of the most frequently reported scam types and experts say they are alarmingly common, impersonating well-known brands and being promoted in search engine advertisements.

items.title: Israel's air strike campaign levelling Gaza City's remaining buildings
items.summary: Israel has dramatically ramped up its attacks in Gaza City in the past week with a targeted campaign to strike its high-rises. Hundreds of structures have been destroyed, forcing thousands of already displaced Palestinians to flee.

items.title: Push for seniors' dental scheme grows ahead of federal election
items.summary: Imagine living in aged care and not having your teeth or dentures properly cleaned and checked each day. That's a risk faced by elderly Australians, prompting calls for the next federal government to boost oral health training and services.

items.title: AFLW wrap: Collingwood ends Sydney's unbeaten run, Carlton thumps Gold Coast, the Power beats the Demons
items.summary: Collingwood, wooden spooners last season, keep Sydney goalless for more than three quarters at home on Saturday for an upset win, as Port Adelaide beat another unbeaten side in Melbourne.

items.title: Australia's growing cohort of tenants fear they will rent forever
items.summary: Home ownership rates in Australia have been falling for decades, and with rental vacancies at record lows and prices at historic highs, many fear their dream of owning a home may be out of reach. Some experts say rental caps could help.

items.title: ASX higher on US rate cut expectations, but markets underestimating inflation risk — as it happened
items.summary: The ASX rises, as do Virgin shares, as the airline reveals the exit pay of its former CEO. Westpac's economics team, led by former RBA assistant governor Luci Ellis, say they think markets are underpricing the risk of a renewed inflation breakout in the US.

items.title: Live updates: World Athletics Championships 2025 in Tokyo, Day 1
items.summary: The 20205 World Athletics Championships get underway in Tokyo, with 14 Aussies in action on night one. Follow live.

items.title: Inside the world of Jeffrey Epstein's friends, associates and alleged co-conspirators
items.summary: Convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein intentionally sought out some of the world's most powerful people. Here's how they have responded to his disgraced reputation.

items.title: ABC Quote Quiz: Birthday cards, bucket lists and (briefly) Banksy
items.summary: See if you can work out who said it, and what they were talking about.

items.title: More than a dozen women complain about Brisbane doctor accused of performing 'sexually motivated' checks
items.summary: Dr Stan Theodoros is facing disciplinary proceedings, lodged by Queensland's health ombudsman, in the Queensland Civil and Administrative Tribunal (QCAT).

items.title: 'Low levels of satisfaction' with healthcare in Canberra for endometriosis, menopause, identified in Women's Health Matters survey
items.summary: A survey of women in Canberra about the state of their wellbeing and health reveals large gaps in access and affordability, as well as the staggering statistic that almost half of respondents felt doctors weren't taking them seriously.

items.title: Artists and users boycotting Spotify over AI use and CEO's military tech
items.summary: A growing number of artists and users are leaving Spotify. What's changed with the streaming giant? And what comes next?

items.title: Rare good news for critically endangered east coast grey nurse sharks
items.summary: Scientists say increasing numbers of east coast grey nurse sharks is rare good conservation news for the critically endangered species.

items.title: Armani drama beyond the grave as will instructs heirs to sell or list on stock market
items.summary: Giorgio Armani's will has surprised fashion watchers as it contains instructions to gradually sell off his company to a luxury brand or seek a listing on the stock market, in seeming contrast to his fiercely independent stance throughout his career.

items.title: Islamophobia has been 'persistent' and 'ignored', envoy says — as it happened
items.summary: A long-awaited report into Islamophobia in Australia has been handed down, with the special envoy finding it has been "persistent" and "ignored".

items.title: US golfer John Daly takes a record 19 shots to play a par-5 on the PGA Tour Champions
items.summary: John Daly is known as "Wild Thing" for his big-hitting, swashbuckling play, but the US golfer's round went right off the rails on the PGA Tour Champions, hitting the water seven times on a par-5.

items.title: Health, climate and community sport: What older voters in the Tasmanian seat of Bass are talking about this election
items.summary: The federal seat of Bass is held by a margin of just 1.4 per cent. For these older voters who live in the electorate, health, climate and community sport are the issues that will decide their vote.

items.title: New Zealand fugitive Tom Phillips killed in shootout with police after four years on the run
items.summary: Tom Phillips is killed during a shootout with police during a burglary in New Zealand's Waikato region, his sister says.

items.title: Who is Larry Ellison and how did he overtake Elon Musk to briefly become the richest person in the world?
items.summary: The switch in the ranking comes after a blockbuster earnings report from Oracle, powered by multi-billion-dollar orders from customers as the AI race heats up.

items.title: Australia and Fiji to press ahead with security treaty talks as Vanuatu deal goes unsigned
items.summary: The government is still racing to expand ties with Pacific nations — particularly the current governments in Fiji and Papua New Guinea — despite a diplomatic setback with Vanuatu.

items.title: How the Jeffrey Epstein saga spread to British politics
items.summary: After dogging the US president for months, evidence of a connection to Jeffrey Epstein has claimed a senior scalp within the British government.

items.title: Growing group of Labor MPs urge 2035 emissions target above Climate Authority's floor
items.summary: A growing cross-factional group within Labor is privately urging for Australia's next major climate target to respect the advice of the Climate Change Authority, which will hand its opinion on a 2035 target to government any day.

items.title: Nepal's gen Z protesters are continuing the fight for their future even after picking a new prime minister
items.summary: A calm has fallen on Nepal's streets after days of violence and chaos. But leaders of the gen Z protest movement say the work's not done.

items.title: Adrianne Lenker on Big Thief's evolution and the making of Double Infinity
items.summary: At the peak of their success, Big Thief faced a major emotional rupture that reshaped the group from the inside out. Now, they've returned with their sixth album, shaped by deep creative trust and a renewed commitment to collaboration.

items.title: The simple system I use for composting
items.summary: Koren Helbig has devised an easy and effective method of turning her food waste and plant trimmings into a nutrient-rich compost for her Adelaide/Tarntanya food gardens.

items.title: Government assessor finds Townsville Mayor Troy Thompson breached code of conduct
items.summary: The Office of the Independent Assessor found Mr Thompson breached conduct rules when circulating an email criticising another council worker's delays in responding to his request for legal funding.

items.title: Vanuatu warns Australia that expanding Woodside's North West Shelf gas project could breach international ruling
items.summary: Australia's move to expand Woodside's North West Shelf gas project has not been welcomed in the Pacific, which is fighting the most dramatic effects of climate change.

items.title: Supreme Court gives Queensland hospital permission to terminate 12yo girl's pregnancy
items.summary: A 12-year-old girl in residential care in Queensland should be allowed to have an abortion, a court rules, after a judge found she was not capable of making the decision herself.

items.title: Construction workers are at higher risk of suicide. Here's how to look out for them
items.summary: Construction workers are nearly twice as likely to take their own lives as other employed Australian men of the same age. Understanding the risks can help us better support those we know in the industry.

items.title: Mobile coverage is an election issue in regional areas. What's been promised?
items.summary: For many regional and remote Australians, reliable mobile coverage can be life-saving. They are desperate for both sides of politics to take meaningful action towards eliminating black spots.

items.summary: Charlie Kirk rose from a teenage conservative campus activist to a top podcaster, culture warrior and ally of US President Donald Trump.

items.title: When does Gout Gout run in the 200m at the 2025 World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, and other key events

items.title: Update your ABC News homepage for more local stories

items.title: The US election is about style more than substance. It's why Kamala Harris needs to nail her DNC speech in about eight seconds
items.summary: When the Democrat presidential candidate Kamala Harris delivers her speech to the Democratic National Convention today, style will be almost everything.

items.title: Heavy police presence monitors thousands of protesters across Australia
items.summary: Rallies against racism and in support of Indigenous sovereignty coincide with mixed anti-government protests in major cities around the country.

items.title: Donald Trump and his 'good man' Anthony Albanese share some common ground
items.summary: The MAGA president's grip on the Republican party is near total while Albanese holds a sway over his left-leaning caucus like few of his Labor predecessors.

items.title: What happens to your data when you trade or recycle your device?
items.summary: A cybercrime expert says trading or recycling electronics may not completely erase personal data and users should adopt a "risk-adjusted strategy" when disposing of devices.

items.title: Wallaroos primed for Rugby World Cup quarterfinal against Canada

items.summary: West Australians planning to visit South-East Asia are being urged to get vaccinated against measles, with two more cases linked with travel to Bali.

items.title: Toni Jordan spent her childhood at the greyhound track, inspiring her new novel Tenderfoot

items.title: Have Your Say: What was the issue, policy or event that decided your vote?

items.summary: Ariana Grande and Lady Gaga took home the biggest awards at this year's MTV VMAs with several nineties stars honoured for their musical legacy.

items.title: A journey through 35 years of Canberra's history since the Raiders last won a minor premiership
items.summary: Two weeks ago, the Canberra Raiders won the NRL's 2025 minor premiership by beating the Wests Tigers. It is their first minor premiership since 1990, and a lot has changed since then.

items.title: Islamophobia envoy calls for religious discrimination laws, review of approach to counter-terrorism
items.summary: In a landmark report, newly-appointed Aftab Malik also calls for counter-terrorism laws and approaches to be reviewed, and for national inquiries into Islamophobia and anti-Palestinian racism.

items.title: Graduates in 'debt vortex' as HECS front and centre for first time in an election

items.title: Evidence points to remains found in Vietnam cave being South-East Asia's earliest known homicide victim
items.summary: It was on a sweltering morning in 2018 in a cave in northern Vietnam when Chris Stimpson and his team uncovered what may be the oldest cold case murder in South-East Asia.

items.summary: Dissatisfaction with the Albanese government's stance on Israel-Palestine among many Arab and Muslim voters threatens to unseat Labor MPs, in some places for the first time.

items.summary: When Nausheen Hashmi moved to a south-west Victorian farming town, she wondered how the locals would greet her and her children. She need not have worried.

items.summary: It's a big day for Queensland sides in the NRLW, as the Broncos — led by skipper Tamika Upton — are far too good for the third-placed Cowboys, while the Titans clinch the last finals spot with a win over Canberra.

items.summary: Krishna Istha has made a habit of turning to performance to solve a problem. So when they needed help to find a sperm donor, the solution was obvious.

items.title: Nourishing and easy sweet potato and lentil bowls - ABC News
items.summary: This jazzy little bowl is made from simple ingredients. The sweet potato is roasted gently with spices and tinned lentils are roasted until crisp.

items.summary: Many of the Rats of Tobruk hailed from the Eyre Peninsula and, after years of work, their legacy has been commemorated by a very special tree taking root.

items.title: Dollars, distance and political power: Inside the barriers to abortion access
items.summary: The reasons abortion is still so hard for some to access are complex. But restrictions imposed at public hospitals last year have provided some clues. At its heart, this is a story about equity, dollars and political gain.

items.summary: As the sound of a British and Irish Lions series victory echoed through the subdued Wallabies press conference, both teams were very clear — winning in Sydney is everything.
